properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wildfire smoke is causing poor air quality and locally reduced visibilities at times. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-26T19:37:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-07-26T03:38:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1854752313.2019

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Overnight temperatures are forecast to remain above 14 degrees Celsius. The heat warning will come to an end Friday morning as Friday day time highs will be well below 29 degrees Celsius. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-26T12:59:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-26T03:38:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1378123654.2019
Area: Thebacha Region including Ft. Smith - Salt River Reserve
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Severe thunderstorms possible this evening. Thunderstorms have developed over northwestern Ontario and will continue this evening. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe and be capable of producing hail of 2 cm or greater. Strong wind gusts and heavy rain are also possible. Frequent lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-07-26T07:59:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-25T22:41:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3971241567.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Severe thunderstorms remain possible this evening. A few rounds of thunderstorms have tracked across northwestern Ontario today. Another round of thunderstorms may develop later this evening. Some of these storms may be strong to severe, so the watch will be maintained for now. The main threat would be up to nickel sized hail. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-07-26T05:59:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-26T01:19:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0616680066.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 10:12 p.m. CDT (11:12 p.m. EDT), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a cluster of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts and up to nickel size hail. One severe thunderstorm is located over Wunnummin Lake, moving east at 60 km/h. Another severe thunderstorm is located near North Caribou Lake, moving east at 65 km/h. Locations impacted include: Wunnummin Lake, Misamikwash Lake, and portions of Pipestone River Provincial Park. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.
Expires: 2019-07-26T06:20:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-26T03:13:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2482258810.2019
Area: Summer Beaver - Wunnummin Lake - Kingfisher Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. An area of low pressure has brought an extended period of heavy rain to northwestern Alberta. General amounts of 40-70 mm are expected by the time rain comes to an end tonight, with localized amounts exceeding 100 mm. ### Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-26T18:29:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-26T03:39:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3877541393.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 8:45 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms is currently located from near Semmens Lake to Gods Lake to Red Sucker Lake and is tracking to the east at 30 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-26T04:39:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-26T01:46:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0538767493.2019
Area: Red Sucker Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada
